summary_reasoning: This Morningstar report covers nearly all expected sections: cover and contents, timely Analyst Notes, Business Description, Strategy & Outlook, Bulls/Bears, Economic Moat, Valuation & Profit Drivers, Risks, Capital Allocation, ESG, and a robust Financials snapshot with multi‑year history and forecasts. It also includes peer context (Alphabet, Snap, Pinterest) and a clear DCF summary tying cost of capital, growth, and margins to the $770 fair value. Depth is generally proportional: moat and valuation are well developed; capital allocation and risk/ESG are substantive; and financial tables are detailed. Evidence is integrated via tables and dated notes, but external source citations are not used in‑text. Redundancy is limited; AI themes recur across sections with added nuance. The main gap is sector‑specific KPIs in the Financials snapshot—MAUs/DAUs, ARPU, ad impressions/pricing are discussed qualitatively but not tabulated alongside financials. A dedicated sensitivity/scenario section is also absent (though scenarios are noted in Analyst Notes). Under the rubric’s hard cap, omission of ≥2 core sector KPIs in the Financials snapshot limits the grade to Fair.

uncited_claims: Repurchased $28B, $19.8B, and $30B in 2022–2024 with no source cited
Analyst Note references US TikTok ban developments without in‑text citation
